data.title: Air Products names Menezes as new CEO; Ghasemi to depart
data.description:
Air Products (NYSE:APD) said it appointed Eduardo Menezes as its new CEO effective February 7, succeeding Seifi Ghasemi, who is leaving the company after more than 10 years of service.

Menezes brings extensive international experience in all key sectors of industrial gases, most recently as executive VP of Linde for Europe, Middle East and Africa, with responsibility for operations in more than 40 countries with $8B-plus in sales and 18K employees.

Air Products (NYSE:APD) also named Wayne Smith as its new Chairman, after serving on the board since 2021; he brings 35 years of senior management experience in the chemicals industries, most recently as Chairman and CEO of BASF during 2015-21.

Air Products (APD) has been involved in a proxy fight witha investor Mantle Ridge, which won three board seats and fought to oust Ghasemi.

data.title: Toppoint Holdings expands partnership with Waste Management, adding up to $2M in annual revenue
data.description:
• Toppoint Holdings (NYSE:TOPP) announced an expansion in its partnership with Waste Management.
  • After Waste Management acquired Winter Brothers Waste Systems, Toppoint is expected to handle an additional 1,000 loads annually. This is expected to bring in up to $2M in annual revenue.
  • Operations for this expansion are set to commence in early Q2 2025.
  • TOPP shares rise 6% premarket on Tuesday.
  • Source: Press release

data.title: Berkshire Hathaway raises stake in Sirius XM
data.description:
Warren Buffett’s Berkshire Hathaway (NYSE:BRK.A) (NYSE:BRK.B) has further raised its bet on Sirius XM Holdings (NASDAQ:SIRI), boosting its stake to over 35%, latest regulatory filings show.

The conglomerate acquired around 2.3M shares of the radio broadcasting firm for about $54M in a series of transactions from Jan. 30-Feb. 03, 2025.

Berkshire now owns 35.4% of SiriusXM (NASDAQ:SIRI). As of Feb. 3, Berkshire Hathaway's subsidiaries own over 103.79M SiriusXM shares, and Berkshire's pension plans own 15.98M shares.

Berkshire (NYSE:BRK.A) (NYSE:BRK.B) has been steadily amplifying its stake in Sirius (SIRI), as majority owner Liberty Media decided to merge its tracking stock with Sirius in the second half of 2024. It began investing in Liberty Media in 2016.

SiriusXM (SIRI) shares rose 3.3% premarket on Tuesday. Shares lost 53% in value over the past year.

data.title: VSee Health announces $340K contract to create AI-enabled EHR system
data.description:
• VSee Health (NASDAQ:VSEE) announced its $340K contract with an EAP provider to build an integrated AI-enabled electronic health records and virtual care delivery platform.
  • VSEE shares rose 1.2% premarket on Tuesday.
  • Source: Press release

data.title: Ferrari Q4 results beat expectations but pumps the brakes on guidance
data.description:
Led by growing demand for personalized vehicles, a strong product mix, and limited exposure to China, Ferrari (NYSE:RACE) saw a 14% increase in sales for the fourth quarter despite a modest 2% improvement in shipments. Profits swelled by 31%, however, resulting in earnings of €2.14 ($2.21), which beat Wall Street’s expectations of €1.84 ($1.90).

“On these solid foundations, we expect further robust growth in 2025, that will allow us to reach one year in advance the high-end of most of our profitability targets for 2026” said CEO Benedetto Vigna.

For the remainder of the year, however, Ferrari (NYSE:RACE) set more cautious guidance on the expectation for increased supply chain costs and a higher tax rate in connection to the change in Italy’s tax incentive program (Patent Box regime). Accordingly, net revenue is expected to increase by ~5% to €7.0B ($7.23B), contributing to a profit of €8.60 ($8.89) per share. This is below the consensus estimates of €7.12B ($7.36B) and €9.07 (9.37), respectively.

Regionally, sales were strongest in the Americas with shipments up 8%, followed by a 6% gain in APAC (excluding Mainland China, Hong Kong and Taiwan). Sales in China, Hong Kong, and Taiwan fell 21%, but only represented less than 1% of total Ferrari (NYSE:RACE) shipments.

The products delivered in the FY24 included ten internal combustion engine models and six hybrid engine models, which represented 49% and 51% of total shipments, respectively.

Shares are more than 5% higher before Tuesday’s opening bell.

data.title: Alpha Modus sues Walgreens for patent infringement
data.description:
• Alpha Modus (NASDAQ:AMOD) announced that its wholly owned subsidiary, Alpha Modus, Corp, has filed a patent infringement lawsuit that also alleges willful infringement against Walgreens Co. in the United States District Court for the Eastern District of Texas.
  • This legal action underscores Alpha Modus’s commitment to protecting its AI-driven retail technology.
  • AMOD shares rise over 20% premarket on Tuesday.
  • Source: Press release

data.title: Okta expects to reduce workforce by ~3% as part of a restructuring plan
data.description:
• Internet services and infrastructure company Okta (NASDAQ:OKTA) announced on Tuesday a restructuring plan that is expected to reduce its workforce by ~3%.
  • OKTA shares were trading -0.40% pre-market at $92.87.
  • The plan involves cutting the headcount by about 180 full-time employees, with the action expected to result in ~$11M of restructuring charges in Q4 of fiscal 2025, ending January 31.
  • The restructuring charges for future cash employee severance and benefits costs will primarily be paid in Q1 of fiscal 2026.
  • Additionally, the company expects to record an insignificant adjustment to its stock-based compensation expense in Q1 of fiscal 2026 related to equity compensation for employees, who were terminated.
  • Okta reaffirmed its financial guidance for Q4 and fiscal 2025.

data.title: PennyMac Financial Services proposeds private offering of $650M of senior notes
data.description:
• PennyMac Financial Services (PFSI) and its subsidiaries announced that it intends to offer $650M aggregate principal amount of senior notes due 2033.
  • Proceeds from the offering will be used to repay some debt, including borrowings under secured MSR facilities, repurchase part of the 5.375% senior notes due October 2025, and for general corporate purposes.
  • Source: Press release

data.title: Fox declares $0.27 dividend
data.description:
• Fox (NASDAQ:FOX) declares $0.27/share semi-annual dividend, in line with previous.
  • Forward yield 1.1%
  • Payable March 26; for shareholders of record March 5; ex-div March 5.
  • See FOX Dividend Scorecard, Yield Chart, & Dividend Growth.

data.title: Apollo Global Q4 earnings beat as inflows boost AUM
data.description:
Apollo Global Management (NYSE:APO) on Tuesday turned in Q4 earnings that topped Wall Street expectations as healthy inflows continued to boost the private equity firm's assets under management.

Q4 adjusted EPS of $2.22, beating the $1.89 average analyst estimate, climbed from $1.85 in the prior quarter and $1.91 a year earlier.

Fee-related earnings advanced to $554M in Q4 from $531M in Q3 and $457M in Q4 2023.

Total AUM of $751B, benefitting from inflows of $33B, rose from $651B in the previous quarter and $548M in the year-ago period.

The year-over-year increase in AUM, Apollo (NYSE:APO) said, reflected $81B of inflows from its Asset Management segment and $71B of gross inflows from Retirement Services, as well as mark-to-market appreciation, partially offset by $59B of outflows mainly driven by normal course activity at Athene and $23 billion of realization activity.

Dry powder of $61B at the end of the three-month period ended Dec. 31, 2024, compared with $64B at the end of Q3.

Origination volume also ticked down to $61B from $62B in Q3.
